input:
US President George W. Bush has indicated he will invite Abbas to the United States for talks, something he never did with Abbas's predecessor, the late Yasser Arafat .
 Question: Does this imply that "Yasser Arafat succeeded Abbas."? Yes or no?

The discovery of the body of a warrior - thought to have died in battle more than 2,000 years ago - could help archaeologists to pinpoint the site of an ancient holy site. The young warrior, aged about 30, with his spear, a sword, his belt and scabbard, stunned archaeologists who found his stone coffin.
 Question: Does this imply that "Altai ice maiden triggers major dispute."? Yes or no?

Boris Becker is a true legend in the sport of tennis. Aged just seventeen, he won Wimbledon for the first time and went on to become the most prolific tennis player.
 Question: Does this imply that "Boris Becker is a Wimbledon champion."? Yes or no?

Fast forward a decade or two and scientists began to notice antibiotic-resistant strains of bacteria.
 Question: Does this imply that "Bacteria is winning the war against antibiotics."? Yes or no?

The capacity people have to adjust and make peace with a new situation, even if they feel vulnerable, is really remarkable, said Randy Quevillon, chair of the psychology department and the Disaster Mental Health Institute at the University of South Dakota.
 Question: Does this imply that "Randy Quevillon is employed at the University of South Dakota."? Yes or no?

A four-day state of emergency has been declared in the capital of Mongolia, Ulaanbaatar after violent protests occurred after allegations of vote rigging and fraud in Sunday's elections. Reports state that 5 people have been killed, and over 300 injured. The injured were police and protesters alike, suffering from smoke poisoning, rubber bullets, and stoning. Among the injured was a Japanese citizen, who was reportedly flown to Japan in the morning.
 Question: Does this imply that "300 people were killed in Mongolia."? Yes or no?

The decision by the British government to suspend flights to Kenya is regrettable, it plays into the hands of terrorists.
 Question: Does this imply that "The British government banned flights to Kenya."? Yes or no?

The Los Angeles Lakers rolled over the Indiana Pacers in Wednesday's the opening round game of the NBA championship series.
 Question: Does this imply that "Lakers win the championship."? Yes or no?

In "Killing the Dream: James Earl Ray and the Assassination of Martin Luther King, JR.", by Gerald Posner (Harvest/Harcourt Brace, $15), the writer who attacked Kennedy conspiracy theories in "Case Closed" takes on Ray's claim of innocence in the 1968 murder of King.
 Question: Does this imply that "Martin Luther King was murdered in 1968."? Yes or no?

Hudson's mother, Darnell Donerson, 57, and brother, Jason Hudson, 29 were found dead in Donerson's home on October 24 and the body of Hudson's 7-year-old nephew, Julian King was found four days later in a stolen SUV. A handgun police say is tied to the case was found nearby, but Reuters reports that Bond did not comment on any evidence in the case.
 Question: Does this imply that "Jason Hudson was Jennifer's brother."? Yes or no?

Three Democrats joined the committee's 10 majority Republicans in a 13-5 vote to advance the conservative judge's nomination to the full Senate. Five Democrats opposed Roberts.
 Question: Does this imply that "The Senate Judiciary Committee, on Thursday, approved Judge John Roberts' nomination as the next Supreme Court Chief Justice, virtually assuring his confirmation by the Senate next week."? Yes or no?

The last Australian to win Miss Universe was Perth's Kerry Anne Wells in 1972.
 Question: Does this imply that "Not since 1972 has an Australian woman been named Miss Universe."? Yes or no?

A man who died during the G20 protests was pushed back by a police line minutes earlier, independent investigators have said. Ian Tomlinson, 47, who died of a heart attack, was blocked from passing through a police cordon as he attempted to walk home from work at a newsagent, the Independent Police Complaints Commission (IPCC) said. He was caught on several CCTV cameras walking up King William Street where he was confronted by uniformed officers shortly before 7.30pm last Wednesday.
 Question: Does this imply that "Ian Tomlinson was shot by a policeman."? Yes or no?

The controversy became more desperate, this summer, when astronomers discovered a new object, larger than Pluto, orbiting in the Kuiper Belt at a distance of nine billion miles from the Sun.
 Question: Does this imply that "The Kuiper Belt is nine billion miles from the Sun."? Yes or no?

Albert Sabin developed an oral, attenuated (live) vaccine, which, with Salk's discovery, brought polio under control.
 Question: Does this imply that "Polio is under control in the world."? Yes or no?

Wal-Mart Stores has asked a US federal appeals court to review a judge's order approving class-action status for a sex-discrimination lawsuit.
 Question: Does this imply that "A lawsuit was filed against Wal-Mart."? Yes or no?

The city continued to grow through much of the 20th century.
 Question: Does this imply that "The city continued to grow, but its services deteriorated."? Yes or no?

A gunman has killed at least nine people in a series of shootings across two towns in the southern US state of Alabama before killing himself. Officials say there were at least four separate shooting incidents. The gunman fired on homes, a petrol station, shops and vehicles in Samson and Geneva near the Florida border.  Five people - including a child - were killed in one home. Several of the victims are believed to have been members of the gunman's family.  The gunman has not been formally identified, but was named in the local press as Michael McLendon.
 Question: Does this imply that "Michael McLendon has killed his child in Samson."? Yes or no?

Iran will hold the first runoff presidential election in its history, between President Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani and Tehran's hard-line mayor, election officials said Saturday.
 Question: Does this imply that "Tehran's hard-line mayor will face Rafsanjani in a runoff election."? Yes or no?

The drawbacks of legalization do not imply that our current version of prohibition is the optimal drug strategy; it may well be possible to implement prohibition in less harmful ways.
 Question: Does this imply that "Drug legalization has benefits."? Yes or no?

Actual statistics about the deterrent value of capital punishment are not available because it is impossible to know who may have been deterred from committing a crime.
 Question: Does this imply that "Capital punishment is a deterrent to crime."? Yes or no?

The New Zealand Rugby League team (Kiwis) have been docked two competition points and hooker Nathan Fien barred from playing in the Gilette Rugby League Tri-Nations series. It comes after allegations of Fien's availability to play for the Kiwi's were exposed by a documentation of his birth certificate. At a hearing the Rugby League International Federation ruled that Fien was unable to play for the kiwis as he was Australian born. Instead of his grandmother a resident of New Zealand, it was in fact his great-grandmother. According to Rugby League International Federation chairman Colin Love, the Kiwis thought great-grandparents were as good as grandparents.
 Question: Does this imply that "Nathan Fien is a resident of Australia."? Yes or no?

Newspapers choke on rising paper costs and falling revenue.
 Question: Does this imply that "The cost of paper is rising."? Yes or no?

Meanwhile, the inquiries spearheaded by Milan magistrates Antonio di Pietro and Gherardo Colombo began to focus on Italy's private and public business sectors.
 Question: Does this imply that "Antonio di Pietro is a magistrate."? Yes or no?

Ruth's 1927 single season record of 60 home runs stood unsurpassed until Roger Maris hit 61 in 1961.
 Question: Does this imply that "Babe Ruth hit 60 home runs in his lifetime."? Yes or no?

The Philippine Stock Exchange Composite Index rose 0.1 percent to 1573.65.
 Question: Does this imply that "The Philippine Stock Exchange Composite Index rose."? Yes or no?

It is an image familiar to many Southern Californians but vividly illustrative in this Egyptian metropolis, where a U.N. conference on global population is trying for the first time to draw clear links between population growth and the environment.
 Question: Does this imply that "The International Conference on Population and Development was held in Cairo."? Yes or no?

Vatican spokesman Joaquin Navarro-Valls announced that Pope John Paul was still in serious condition, but he was not in a coma.
 Question: Does this imply that "Joaquin Navarro-Valls is the Vatican Spokesman."? Yes or no?

Catastrophic floods in Europe endanger lives and cause human tragedy as well as heavy economic losses.
 Question: Does this imply that "Flooding in Europe causes major economic losses."? Yes or no?

The U.S. handed power on June 30 to Iraqâs interim government chosen by the United Nations and Paul Bremer, former governor of Iraq.
 Question: Does this imply that "Transfer of power in Iraq on June 30."? Yes or no?

It was difficult to assess the objectives behind increased militia activity in East Timor, but its intent seemed to be to continue a pattern of violence against civilians and the United Nations Transitional Administration in East Timor (UNTAET) in order to undermine the transition process, Hedi Annabi, Assistant Secretary-General for Peacekeeping Operations, told the Security Council this morning.
 Question: Does this imply that "Guerrillas increase activity in East Timor."? Yes or no?

FermiLab's goal is to ensure that if a program runs and is certified on RedHat Enterprise, then it will run on the corresponding Fermi Linux LTS release. They have built Fermi Linux LTS for Fermilab's use, and that is their ultimate goal.
 Question: Does this imply that "FermiLab created Linux LTS."? Yes or no?
